title: SpaceX providing Starlink services to DoD under ‘unique terms and conditions’
summary: A $70 million contract the U.S. Space Force awarded to SpaceX for Starlink internet services includes “unique terms and conditions” not included in previous commercial contracts.

title: Alba Orbital Move into new PocketQube Manufacturing Facility
summary:
Scottish satellite builder and mission management company Alba Orbital announced 2 October that it had begun the process of moving into a new manufacturing facility. Alba Orbital was founded in 2012 with two aims: to maximize the value of PocketQube satellites and to offer an Earth observation data service. To date, the company has launched […]
The post Alba Orbital Move into new PocketQube Manufacturing Facility appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Artemis Accords signatories seek to boost transparency and safety in lunar exploration
summary: A working group of nations signed up to the Artemis Accords aim to increase transparency and safety of civil lunar exploration missions.

title: Astronomers raise interference concerns from AST SpaceMobile satellite
summary: A prototype satellite launched by AST SpaceMobile a year ago is at times one the brightest objects in the night sky, raising new concerns about its impact on astronomy.

title: Air Force Research Lab awards design contracts for nuclear powered spacecraft
summary: Intuitive Machines, Lockheed Martin and Westinghouse Government Services won contracts from the Air Force Research Laboratory to advance technologies for nuclear powered space vehicles.
